summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an AT&T representative named James, regarding the submission of two subpoenas for telephone records. The email includes attachments of the subpoenas and a draft certification, seeking responsive records from AT&T.

persons.name: James
persons.context: Recipient of the email from the prosecutor, being asked to respond to subpoenas for telephone records.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, coordinating the issuance of subpoenas to AT&T for records.

connections.description: Prosecutor communicating with AT&T representative to obtain records via subpoena as part of an investigation.

events.title: Phone call regarding subpoenas
events.description: A phone call took place between the prosecutor and James from AT&T to discuss the subpoenas for records.

events.title: Subpoenas issued to AT&T
events.description: Two subpoenas were issued to AT&T, one for a specific invoice and one broader, seeking responsive telephone records.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively subpoenaing AT&T for telephone records as part of an investigation in July 2021.
Two specific subpoenas were issued: one targeting a particular invoice and one with a broader scope.
The communication indicates coordination between law enforcement and AT&T to obtain certification for the records.
